attributes.comment:
This is an extraordinarily bad idea that should not be enacted. A better alternative,
suggested by the New York Times, is to change the funding structure for this
agency so that tax dollars can supplement the funding of this agency in addition to
fees collected.

I hope this is really an attempt to improve customer service, which I agree is
horrible and needs improvement. Maybe you should outsource the paperwork to
Indian IT firms, which currently set the standard for responsiveness and attention
to detail in transactional work. I've called Nebraska SC and I've called my
company's help desk in Bangalore, and I much prefer to talk to Bangalore.

I am afraid however that the customer service argument is a ruse, and that the
agency is really trying to reduce its workload and discourage applicants by pricing
their services out of the purchasing range of prospective legal immigrants. This
escalates the "pre-emptive poll tax" fee structure that makes avoiding legal status
such an attractive (or downright necessary) option to low-income immigrants.

Recent political developments have clearly shown that USCIS lacks the mandate
for unilateral action against poor immigrant families and should not take action
until comprehensive reform to ease immigration requirements have been passed
by the new Congress.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By A.D.F.
